content: filet crochet baby blanket 2 x 12 oz skeins of light weight/baby yarn in different colors 3 75 or 4 mm crochet hook this pattern has been written for ease of understanding if you finished size 28 x 48 inches prefer please feel free to use the patterns for the blanket or individual shapes without the numbers however it is very helpful even for those who are experienced with filet crochet to row 1 start with color a and chain 109 stitches for foundation make use of the numbered pattern chain keep hold of stitch 108 and make 3 additional chains to count as your first double_crochet then make a double_crochet in stitch 108 of the every white space on the patterns is a single double_crochet foundation chain this means you will effectively make 112 stitch and every black space is a chain space skipping the chain stitches then start your first row of double_crochet in the 5th chain double_crochet beneath it every spot along the grid of the from the hook double_crochet in every chain across 109 double_crochet pattern will either be a chain space skipping one stitch on the previous row one double_crochet stitch in the stitch below it or row 2 chain 3 counts as first double_crochet double_crochet in every stitch across one popcorn 109 double_crochet row 3 - 97 begin following the grid pattern for the shapes if you are using the un-numbered pattern double_crochet 1 for every white stitches to know space and chain 1 skipping 1 stitch on previous row for every double_crochet double_crochet the first stitch of each row will begin black space on the rabbits use 1 popcorn on every red with a chain 3 to count as 1 double_crochet make sure to put your last double_crochet space if you are using the un-numbered pattern i recommend of each row into the top of the previous row s chain 3 printing the corresponding pdf pages and taping them together chain chain if you are using the numbered pattern the numbers indicate popcorn make 5 double_crochet in the same stitch of the previous the number of double_crochet in a row before the next chain 1 and are row then remove the hook from the current working loop placed in every segment of 3 or more double_crochet in a row this is stick hook into the top of the first of these 5 double_crochet then grab the helpful for speeding things along simply read the number double_crochet working loop and pull it through the top of that first double_crochet like a that many stitches then return to the pattern to see what slip_stitch make sure to tighten the top of the finished popcorn comes next unfortunately i can t get this to convert well from stitch a bit so that it sits nicely with the next row of stitches excel to any other file format so you will need to use the excel file for this materials row 98 and 99 double_crochet in every
